edu.umn.ncs
[Groovy] Class Subject

java.lang.Object
  Subject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
class Subject

This class represents a subject enrolled in a particular study or substudy. Once a person is considered 'enrolled' by the study protocol, a Subject record should be created for that person.

Property Summary
java.lang.String appCreated

This field should be assigned the name of the application that is creating an instance of this class.
static java.lang.Object constraints

This contains any constraints for this domain class.

java.util.Date dateCreated

This field is automatically assigned the date that this particular ContactRole instance was created
EnrollmentType enrollment

This defines the enrollment type for the subject as most studies have at least a control and an intervention group.

static java.lang.Object hasMany

This option provides the subject to be enrolled in sevaral sub-groups
java.util.Date lastUpdated

This field should be propogated with the current date and time "new Date()" that an instance of this class is updated.

static java.lang.Object mapping

This mapping defines the default sort order of this domain class to be by subjectId
Person person

This is the person that is tied to this subject record.

boolean randomized

This boolean is used in case a study assigned a subjectId before the subject is offially enrolled in the study.
java.util.Date selectionDate

This is the date that the subject was "officially" enrolled in the study.

Study study

This is the study that this subject is associated with.
java.lang.String subjectId

This field is the cross-site, central ID assigned to the subject.

java.lang.String userCreated

This field should be assigned the username of the authenticated user that is creating an instance of this class.
java.lang.String userUpdated

This field should be propogated with the username of the authenticated user when an instance of this class is updated.

Property Detail

appCreated

java.lang.String appCreated
This field should be assigned the name of the application that is creating an instance of this class.

constraints

static java.lang.Object constraints
This contains any constraints for this domain class. Non-default constraints for this class are
  • subjectId is limited to 16 characters
  • lastUpdated is nullable (optional)
  • userUpaded is nullable (optional)

dateCreated

java.util.Date dateCreated
This field is automatically assigned the date that this particular ContactRole instance was created

enrollment

EnrollmentType enrollment
This defines the enrollment type for the subject as most studies have at least a control and an intervention group. This is a 1:N relationship as you can have a 1-N arm study, in fact three arm studies are rather common.

hasMany

static java.lang.Object hasMany
This option provides the subject to be enrolled in sevaral sub-groups

lastUpdated

java.util.Date lastUpdated
This field should be propogated with the current date and time "new Date()" that an instance of this class is updated. Grails will automatically take care of this per section 5.5.1 of the Grails 1.3.7 documentation.

mapping

static java.lang.Object mapping
This mapping defines the default sort order of this domain class to be by subjectId

person

Person person
This is the person that is tied to this subject record. Oner person can have more than one Subject instances if they are enrolled in more than one study/sub-study, but each Subject record ties to only one subject, and in turn is a 1:N relationship

randomized

boolean randomized
This boolean is used in case a study assigned a subjectId before the subject is offially enrolled in the study.

selectionDate

java.util.Date selectionDate
This is the date that the subject was "officially" enrolled in the study. Often it is referred to as the "randomization date" or "enrollment date".

study

Study study
This is the study that this subject is associated with.

subjectId

java.lang.String subjectId
This field is the cross-site, central ID assigned to the subject. As this ID is often a string containing check-digits, and is not controlled by the managing study center, this is a separate ID from the 'id' attribute. Common formats seen are: 05-12345-6, 5012345-6, 001234501, MN-0123456, etc...

userCreated

java.lang.String userCreated
This field should be assigned the username of the authenticated user that is creating an instance of this class.

userUpdated

java.lang.String userUpdated
This field should be propogated with the username of the authenticated user when an instance of this class is updated.

 
Constructor Detail

Subject

Subject()

 
Method Detail

toString

java.lang.String toString()
This is the default String converter method for this class. This method returns the following: 
"${study}, ${subjectId}"
